title: Beacon Chain Crashing on 2.0.1
body:
# ðŸž Bug Report

### Description

The beacon chain binary cannot connect to any peers, and then crashes on version 2.0.1

### Has this worked before in a previous version?

Yes everything has worked as intended on prior versions on this machine. Version 2.0.1 worked as intended for a few days, until these errors began hours ago.

## ðŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction

Starting 2.0.1 beacon chain as a systemd service:
`ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/beacon-chain --datadir=/var/lib/prysm/beacon --http-web3provider=https://mainnet.infura.io/v3/REDACTED --fallback-web3provider=https://eth-mainnet.alchemyapi.io/v2/REDACTED --fallback-web3provider=https://REDACTED.eth.rpc.rivet.cloud/ --accept-terms-of-use --enable-upnp --p2p-max-peers 128 --disable-broadcast-slashings --enable-peer-scorer --enable-next-slot-state-cache --verbosity=debug
`
This worked for days so I am unsure the reason the error has begun occuring.

## ðŸ”¥ Error

```
Oct 16 15:26:11 ubuntu systemd[1]: prysmbeacon.service: Scheduled restart job, restart counter is at 1.
Oct 16 15:26:11 ubuntu systemd[1]: Stopped Prysm Eth2 Client Beacon Node.
Oct 16 15:26:11 ubuntu systemd[1]: Started Prysm Eth2 Client Beacon Node.
Oct 16 15:26:11 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:26:11" level=error msg="enable-next-slot-state-cache is deprecated and has no effect. Do not use this flag, it will be deleted soon." prefix=flags
Oct 16 15:26:11 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:26:11" level=warning msg="Running on Ethereum Consensus Mainnet" prefix=flags
Oct 16 15:26:11 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:26:11" level=warning msg="Enabled feature flag" enable-peer-scorer="Enable experimental P2P peer scorer" prefix=flags
Oct 16 15:26:11 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:26:11" level=warning msg="Disabled feature flag" disable-broadcast-slashings="Disables broadcasting slashings submitted to the beacon node." prefix=flags
Oct 16 15:26:11 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:26:11" level=info msg="Checking DB" database-path="/var/lib/prysm/beacon/beaconchaindata" prefix=node
Oct 16 15:26:11 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:26:11" level=info msg="Deposit contract: 0x00000000219ab540356cbb839cbe05303d7705fa" prefix=node
Oct 16 15:26:11 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:26:11" level=debug msg="ECDSA private key generated" prefix=p2p
Oct 16 15:26:38 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:26:38" level=debug msg="Replaying state from slot 2277376 till slot 2294240" prefix=state-gen
Oct 16 15:30:36 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:36" level=info msg="Waiting for state to be initialized" prefix=initial-sync
Oct 16 15:30:36 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:36" level=info msg="Starting beacon node" prefix=node version="Prysm/v2.0.1/843ed50e0acc97609a4180e1d9240f7bca026d60. Built at: 2021-10-05 16:21:05+00:00"
Oct 16 15:30:36 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:36" level=debug msg="Starting 9 services: [*p2p.Service *powchain.Service *attestations.Service *blockchain.Service *initialsync.Service *sync.Service *rpc.Service *gateway.Gateway *prometheu>
Oct 16 15:30:36 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:36" level=debug msg="Starting service type *p2p.Service" prefix=registry
Oct 16 15:30:36 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:36" level=debug msg="Starting service type *powchain.Service" prefix=registry
Oct 16 15:30:36 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:36" level=debug msg="Starting service type *attestations.Service" prefix=registry
Oct 16 15:30:36 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:36" level=debug msg="Starting service type *blockchain.Service" prefix=registry
Oct 16 15:30:36 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:36" level=debug msg="Starting service type *initialsync.Service" prefix=registry
Oct 16 15:30:36 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:36" level=debug msg="Starting service type *sync.Service" prefix=registry
Oct 16 15:30:36 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:36" level=debug msg="Starting service type *rpc.Service" prefix=registry
Oct 16 15:30:36 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:36" level=debug msg="Starting service type *gateway.Gateway" prefix=registry
Oct 16 15:30:36 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:36" level=debug msg="Starting service type *prometheus.Service" prefix=registry
Oct 16 15:30:36 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:36" level=info msg="gRPC server listening on port" address="127.0.0.1:4000" prefix=rpc
Oct 16 15:30:36 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:36" level=warning msg="You are using an insecure gRPC server. If you are running your beacon node and validator on the same machines, you can ignore this message. If you want to know how to e>
Oct 16 15:30:36 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:36" level=debug msg="Starting prometheus service" address="127.0.0.1:8080" prefix=prometheus
Oct 16 15:30:36 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:36" level=info msg="Starting gRPC gateway" address="127.0.0.1:3500" prefix=gateway
Oct 16 15:30:36 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:36" level=info msg="Starting API middleware" prefix=gateway
Oct 16 15:30:37 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:37" level=info msg="Connected to eth1 proof-of-work chain" endpoint="https://mainnet.infura.io/***" prefix=powchain
Oct 16 15:30:39 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:39" level=debug msg="Replaying state from slot 2277376 till slot 2294240" prefix=state-gen
Oct 16 15:30:59 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:59" level=debug msg="Deposit registered from deposit contract" eth1Block=13425202 merkleTreeIndex=249201 prefix=powchain publicKey=0x95b84ce76ddd06e92b7d062a63d285e329a6ae09cd8a6a973d12b28118>
Oct 16 15:30:59 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:59" level=debug msg="Deposit registered from deposit contract" eth1Block=13425202 merkleTreeIndex=249202 prefix=powchain publicKey=0xb76c73ed97de2e258c00a24e224ac6b73d09f2ded87f395098c6bcf3cc>     
~~~<removed deposits to save space>~~~~~
Oct 16 15:30:59 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:59" level=debug msg="Deposit registered from deposit contract" eth1Block=13427086 merkleTreeIndex=249226 prefix=powchain publicKey=0x8785b868722b85354248c7d3bb5b9fa89ef80a6b6e91d2341c2980445c>
Oct 16 15:30:59 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:30:59" level=debug msg="Deposit registered from deposit contract" eth1Block=13427094 merkleTreeIndex=249227 prefix=powchain publicKey=0x8ae3775e45022957834133354344392159ed0ad498506253681931fdd3>
Oct 16 15:31:02 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:31:02" level=debug msg="Replaying state from slot 2277376 till slot 2294240" prefix=state-gen
Oct 16 15:31:17 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:31:17" level=debug msg="Sending Goodbye message to peer" Reason="fault/error" peer=16Uiu2HAkw5FxDzpcYaWhbPTz7SX1z5fnfXK6Je3UC4bhzrXfRzxA prefix=sync
Oct 16 15:32:18 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:32:18" level=info msg="New gRPC client connected to beacon node" addr="127.0.0.1:54446" prefix=rpc
Oct 16 15:34:25 ubuntu systemd[1]: prysmbeacon.service: Main process exited, code=killed, status=9/KILL
Oct 16 15:34:25 ubuntu systemd[1]: prysmbeacon.service: Failed with result 'signal'.
Oct 16 15:34:30 ubuntu systemd[1]: prysmbeacon.service: Scheduled restart job, restart counter is at 2.
Oct 16 15:34:30 ubuntu systemd[1]: Stopped Prysm Eth2 Client Beacon Node.
Oct 16 15:34:30 ubuntu systemd[1]: Started Prysm Eth2 Client Beacon Node.
~
```


When restarting the beacon chain service, I also sometimes see these errors:

```
Oct 16 15:15:02 ubuntu systemd[1]: Stopping Prysm Eth2 Client Beacon Node...
Oct 16 15:15:02 ubuntu beacon-chain[2892]: time="2021-10-16 15:15:02" level=info msg="Stopping beacon node" prefix=node
Oct 16 15:15:02 ubuntu beacon-chain[2892]: time="2021-10-16 15:15:02" level=error msg="Unable to process past logs could not process block: could not process block operation: could not process block attestations: could not verify attestation at index 119 in block: could not interface with committee cache: context canceled" prefix=pow>
Oct 16 15:15:02 ubuntu beacon-chain[2892]: time="2021-10-16 15:15:02" level=fatal msg="Could not fetch beacon state by root: could not process block: could not process block operation: could not process block attestations: could not verify attestation at index 0 in block: could not interface with committee cache: context canceled" pr>
```

## ðŸŒ  Your Environment

**Operating System:**

Linux ubuntu 5.4.0-88-generic #99-Ubuntu SMP Thu Sep 23 17:29:00 UTC 2021 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)**

Prsym 2.0.1

**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?**

Can provide public keys if necessary but prefer not to. Just shows validator hasn't worked in 9-10 hours.

-------------

Any ideas? Should I just remove the DB and recreate? I am missing attestations right now (and have been all night)

Did you have any abrupt crashes ?
```
Oct 16 15:31:02 ubuntu beacon-chain[3583]: time="2021-10-16 15:31:02" level=debug msg="Replaying state from slot 2277376 till slot 2294240" prefix=state-gen

```
This log indicates that you have no historical state saved for 16000 slots, which is very unusual. As we save states every 2048 slots by default.

@nisdas Unfortunately my journalctl logs do not go back that far, but as I noted it was working for days then suddenly stopped attesting ~10 hours ago, so an abrupt crash would make sense.

Is there any way to 'roll back' the chain and have it re-sync those missing blocks, similar to setHead() in geth?

If not, would removing the database be the only viable path forward?

Thanks for your time and assistance!

> Is there any way to 'roll back' the chain and have it re-sync those missing blocks, similar to setHead() in geth?

Unfortunately not :( , I wanted to have something similar implemented to prysm for a while but I havent had the bandwidth to get around it. You might have to resync your node here unfortunately, there is a chance the db is corrupted.

That's too bad, I'll go ahead and use --clear-db and resync. I'll follow up to confirm that all is resolved and close the issue.

Hopefully that does it. Thanks again!

Update 21 hours later - still re-syncing. Will update when complete.

After fully re-syncing, everything appears to be operating normally!

Thanks for the quick help @nisdas !  Cheers
